Reviews.Title: “A great stay!”
Reviews.Author: hookedonafeeling
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in July when rooms in Chueca can be hard to come by. The location was perfect, the staff was incredibly friendly, and the room was very clean. I booked several months in advance, but the single room wasn't available the last night of my stay. I asked to be switched to one if it became available and was impressed that they'd actually kept that notation on the books for all those months. I'd definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Hostal five minutes' walk to the centre”
Reviews.Author: Olyver_Minu
Reviews.Content: The "hostal" is located on the top floor of an old building close to Madrid centre (Plaza Vazquez). The room was clean with a small and nice private bathroom, perfect for a short stay in the city. Most notably, there is free 24h wifi connection in every room. A member of the staff is always at the reception, with the possibility to come back home late. The staff is very kind and helpful. We'll strongly suggest this hostal to everyone as a good, cheap and well-located accomodation for a weekend in Madrid.

Reviews.Title: “Okay but wouldn't stay here again.”
Reviews.Author: Morgan F
Reviews.Content: This was not our first choice hostal - it was our 4th choice actually but all the other places we looked at were booked. The location was great - Chuecas is a really fun area with great, alternative restaurants, the new market located down the road and only a block or two off of Gran Vía. However, I felt really uncomfortable during my entire stay because of the "friendly" staff. In order to enter you must ring a doorbell and wait for someone to open the door (this always takes some time). Before you leave you must leave your key at the front in a box (this is normal in Spain to leave your key at the front desk and it never bothered me before) but when you come back you're not allowed to grab it from the box. You aren't allowed to adjust the AC temperature either in your room so I was either freezing or really hot. The internet didn't work and the bathroom was very small like another reviewer said. The walls are also super thin and I was woken up by my neighbors alarm every morning and also heard suitcases being wheeled down the hall (I was the first room right next to the lobby). Overall, I felt like I was staying at a host family's house and had to walk on cracked eggshells. I felt uncomfortable the entire time and although the location was great and the price was reasonable - I would not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Value priced basics”
Reviews.Author: twigor
Reviews.Content: The staff was very friendly and helpful. The location is very convenient not far off Calle de Grand Via, close to metro and major sites. The rooms were basic but clean and offered a comfortable bed. The bathroom in our room was very small making it difficult to manuver while performing routine tasks. While the room was clean, there was some mold in the grout of the shower/tub area..

Reviews.Title: “Convenient location and affordable”
Reviews.Author: maduarte
Reviews.Content: We stayed for one night at Hostal Zamora, which is on the fifth floor of an apartment building. The hotel does not provide breakfast but has a vending machine. The rooms and bathrooms were the standard small size (common in Europe). The hotel is very conveniently located three blocks from a metro station and within walking distance of La Gran Via, La Puerta del Sol, etc. The staff was friendly and helped us look for a bank nearby. The one negative was room cleanliness, which was not up to par - I found a piece of gum stuck to the top of the bed frame. The room safe is coin-operated.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place, good location”
Reviews.Author: CurryCricketer
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 4 nights in a twin room. The room was spacious enough, though bathroom was a little small & dimly lit. Had a window opening out onto the plaza below, which let plenty of natural light into the room. Staff were very friendly, and provided directions, tips and advice readily. Location is about 15 minutes walk to Sol, though as it is located between two metro stations getting around was not an issue.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly service, cheap and great location”
Reviews.Author: Sarah C
Reviews.Content: Four of us stayed here for one night in the quadruple room. It was great as we each had our own bed and we paid 96 in total staying in downtown Madrid. We felt safe as there was 24 hour reception. The clerks were downright friendly, sharing tourist information with us and other things. As soon as I made the reservation they called me to answer my question about parking. There is a vending and coffee machine in the lobby. We were cold and asked for the heater and the clerk was quite apologetic about it. The room was clean and the wifi was working. We had a nice stay thanks to the service.

Reviews.Title: “spotlessly clean”
Reviews.Author: kjh555
Reviews.Content: Just returned from Spain a week ago and spent two nights at Hostal Zamora. The room and bathroom were spotlessly clean, the shower was an adequate size, the WiFi was good, the location couldn't be beat, and the staff very nice. For only 56 Euro/night we couldn't have been more pleased. Try Petit Comite for dinner, about a block away around the corner. I'm gluten intolerant and they were very accommodating to my needs. The food was delicious.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap, clean and centrally located”
Reviews.Author: C&B75
Reviews.Content: 3 people, 3 twin beds, $78 euros. Clean room. Comfortable beds. Clean bathroom. Just a couple blocks off Gran Via. Friendly staff. I forgot my toothbrush and they gave me one nice and new in a wrapper. Also they recommended for parking was paying for 1 hour or 2, since 2 hours is limit on street, but then from 8 p.m. on street parking is free until 9 a.m. Worked well. A car is not the best way to get around.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, centrally located, and excellent staff.”
Reviews.Author: Hispanophile46
Reviews.Content: It is a comfortable, moderate hostal. People are very helpful. The place is kept tidy and neat. The staff is truly superlative and more than willing to answer questions and help out however they can. I make it a point to stay there whenever I am in Madrid. Its location is ideal for everything I want to do in Madrid.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great staff, great value for money!”
Reviews.Author: Nooney_btn
Reviews.Content: I came here with a friend for my birthday. Wasn't too sure what to expect from a hostel but was pleasantly surprised with the whole package! Great room with our own bathroom, balcony (well almost!) overlooking the square. The friendliest of staff who couldn't do enough to make our stay more comfortable. The room was cleaned daily and no matter what time we came back from the bars and clubs we were always welcomed...despite what state we were in :/ (FYI the vending machine in the lobby comes in VERY handy!). At the end of our time here we didn't want to leave. Perfect location, amazing value for money and great staff. Definitely be coming back again and would strongly advise all other to give it a go.

HotelInfo.Name: Hostal Zamora
HotelInfo.Address: Plaza Vazquez de Mella, 1. 4 Izda., 28004 Madrid, Spain
